sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1:
Let X = {1, 2} and Y = {3, 4}. Find the following sets: 

(i) (X × Y) ∪ (Y × X) 

(ii) (Y × X) ∪ (X × Y) 

Show that (i) and (ii) are not equal and hence prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
